alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 5:02AM MDT until June 15 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. .Water levels will be high today and tonight. Expect high flows at least through the middle of the week. For the Wind River Basin...including Crowheart, Kinnear, and Riverton...Minor to Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor to moderate flooding will continue today and tonight. * WHERE...Wind River near Crowheart. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Bankfull stage. At 9.5 feet, Very minor low land flooding begins. At 10.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor low land flooding becomes more widespread. Access road to gage begins to be covered with water. At 10.5 feet, Moderate low land flooding upstream and downstream of gage. Access to gage is becomes limited. At 11.0 feet, Major low land and agricultural flooding upstream and downstream. High water begins to impact Highway 26 northwest of Morton to the Highway 26 Bridge. Access to gage is severely limited. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM MDT Monday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain above flood stage today and tonight. Currently, a maximum value of 10.7 feet is forecast. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive through flooded areas. Caution is urged when near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
